intro: Jasminanthes xuanlienensis, commonly known as the Xuanlien jasmine, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia, particularly Vietnam. It belongs to the Oleaceae family and is characterized by its fragrant, white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has compound leaves with opposite arrangement and produces small, oval-shaped fruits. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and aromatic properties. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its natural habitat.
